headings.value: 2. Fetching weather info from openweathermap API
Example with IFFIE: (Immediately Invoked Function Expression)

Conclusion: We learned how to install fetch for nodejs. How to implement simple fetch callback. And finally async await. This was an initial step for fetching a weather API you can use lots of cool things with it If you want to see a live example of this weather API you can go the link below. Most of the things we've done here with an API is same for every API. So in future you can make use of fetch. Thanks for reading 😄.

frontmatter.title: Fetch API in node.js with weather API

nodes.excerpt: Ever since I started learning react I heard this buzzword  Functional Programming . I have searched all over the internet and found some…

headings.value: Main concepts to learn in Functional Programming:
Implementing of functional programming in JS with (Map, Reduce and Filter)

I will be covering most used functional array methods and JS which are Map, Reduce and Filter. These are the holy grail of functional programming in JavaScript. It is the best way iterate over arrays without changing them. Lets get started.
Example 1: Finding square of each number in array
Example 2: Add the index of the current item into itself
Example 3: Extract full name and title of the employees from given object
Example 1: Find how many students pass the test
Example 2: Find dogs from the given array
Example 1: Find the sum of the provided numbers
Example 2: Find the average salary of the given employees

Conclusion: I've just scratched a surface using on the functional programming part, JS has many other methods which comes under functional programming, But I think these are the main ones. My react journey has been very easy because of these methods and overall JS too. I encourage you to master these methods so you can write efficient JS code. Thanks for reading. Follow me on github I post well documented code with various examples on m github .
